results.title: Bad luck = Zezowate szczescie [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Zespol Filmowy Kamera and Andrzej Munk
results.brief_description: This highly amusing and barbed Polish satire recounts twenty years in the life of Jan Piszczyk, a hapless everyman, whose life is marred by misfortune and bad timing. In an extended flashback sequence Jan first tells of his harassment at the hands of taunting schoolboys, and a disastrous spell at boy scouts. Despite living with his dismissive and draconian father, Jan senses the tide has turned when he falls for a student he is tutoring. But alas it is not to be - his romantic life is marred by accidental involvement in student fascist politics and he is harassed continuously when mistaken for a Jew. Jan joins the army, in the hope of impressing women but is called up when WWII erupts, erroneously arrested when he dons another’s uniform, and mercilessly ridiculed and ostracised when taken for a spy by fellow POWs. Jan’s failure at adaptation, in a rapidly changing world, leads to increasing alienation from his fellow man and a continuous lament at his fate or ‘bad luck’ that dogs him. With an episodic structure, and utilising an inventive soundscape, not dissimilar to that of Jacques Tati, the film establishes a gently mocking tone that is not only humorous but also decidedly sardonic. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Bad lieutenant (D)
results.creator_credit: Bad Lt Productions, Mary Kane, Edward Pressman and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: The film that put director Abel Ferrara on the film map, “Bad lieutenant” deconstructs the path from debauchery to redemption for a corrupt New York cop. Harvey Keitel stars as the out of control police lieutenant, turning in a mesmerizing performance that can only be described as feral. Co-written by Ferrara with Zoe Lund (who starred in Ferrara’s 1981 perverse revenge film “Ms. 45” and who also makes a brief appearance in “Bad lieutenant”), the film explores familiar terrain for the director, mainly debasement and redemption. Ferrara, not one to shy away from the darker aspects of human nature, follows his law enforcing protagonist as he gambles, steals, takes drugs and in one of the most uncomfortable scenes, sexually coerces two teenage girls. When a young nun is brutally raped on the alter of a local church, the ‘bad’ Lieutenant is called into the investigation. The horrific circumstances of the crime forces the corrupt Lieutenant to examine his own life, sending him into a spiral of despair and ultimately a chance at personal salvation. Cast includes: Paul Calderone, Victor Argo, Frankie Thorn, Paul Hipp, Victoria Bastel, Robin Burrows.

results.title: Bad by design: designers break the rules
results.creator_credit: Blurred, Australian Film Commission, Film Queensland, Jo Forsyth, Damien Ledwich and Terry Murphy
results.brief_description: From the Australian Film Commission’s Micro Docs Series II, Bad by Design explores the designing and creative process of three Australian designers; Max Bannah (Animator), Elisabeth Watson-Brown (Architect) and Mimmo Cozzolino (Graphic Designer). They reveal their goals with their work and how they’ve made their unique vision and approach succeed. All are highly accomplished in their own right and give the viewer a glimpse of their motivations and creative outlook. Illustrative animations by Damien Ledwich based on the Designers are intermixed throughtout.

results.title: Bad boys of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Amvest Video, Matthew Hane and Scott Marvel
results.brief_description: ‘Bad boys of Hollywood’ provides an irreverent look at the changing face of Hollywood and the men who contributed to the ‘bad boy’ image of Hollywood during the 20th Century. Errol Flynn is featured with behind the scenes stories of his drinking, philandering and devil may care mischief making. Sean Penn gives meaning to the phrase “Let’s party!” and Steve McQueen provides a bunch of Hollywood producers with his version of ‘piss-take’ humour. Presented are many stories about these bad but lovable rogues, men who symbolised a changing society and reached iconic status for their off-screen antics. Narrated by Jeff Lupetin this video also features: Ronald Reagan, Marlon Brando, Robert Mitchum, Jack Nicholson, James Dean and John Belushi. WARNING: POOR QUALITY SOUND LEVEL

results.title: Bad boy Bubby
results.creator_credit: Fandango, Bubby Pty Ltd (Adelaide), Domenico Procacci, Giorgio Draskovic and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: Bubby (Nicholas Hope in a knockout performance) has spent the first thirty-five years of his life locked in a filthy room by a mother who systematically emotionally and sexually abuses him. His first encounter with his father ends in a violent confrontation which results in Bubby breaking through to the outside world. Alone and frightened, a child in an adult man’s body, he begins his first tentative steps into humanity. This strange, absorbing and distressing film is a stunning investigation into the alienation lacerating urban contemporary Australia. Watching the world through Bubby’s eyes challenges the viewer to re-examine our conventional ideas of what is “normal” and what is “strange”. Family, sexual politics, work, art, and adulthood are questioned by Bubby’s progress through the modern world. Winner of four AFI awards and the Grand Jury Special Prize at the Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Bacteria and Health (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Diagrams and experiments show that by taking simple precautions such as disinfecting and dressing wounds, washing hands in soapy water and being aware of the presence of bacteria, we can remain healthy. It also discussed the ways in which our bodies cope with bacteria, and whether they are useful or harmful to the body.

results.title: Bacteria
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: Explains external and internal structures, manner of feeding, reproductive processes, classifications, and the ecological importance of bacteria. Also shows cell division and conjugation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Backyard theatre: Michel Tremblay and Andre Brassard
results.brief_description: Playwright Michel Tremblay and director Andre Bassard have a talent for capturing the earthy wit and language of Montreal’s east-end working class neighbourhood, rendering them into live theatre described by some critics as “outrageously funny”. Both their vision and their style have had an important influence on other Quebec artists.

results.title: Backyard bugs
results.brief_description: Young Antonio is wondering how he will fill in time during his summer vacation, when he finds a pair of headphones in the grass. He puts them on and hears music which takes him on an adventure in his backyard, discovering bugs and the places they live. Students will learn to classify bugs by counting their legs and body parts. They will also be introduced to the functions of basic body parts and the phenomenon of metamorphosis. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
